article.title: Blackridge%2C_Pennsylvania
article.paragraph: Blackridgeis a community in easternAllegheny County, PennsylvaniaAllegheny Countyand is a suburb ofPittsburgh, Pennsylvania. This community consists of about 650 private homes built in 1920-1949, Blackridge Estates was and remains one of the area's largest residential communities.

Blackridge lies in the municipalities ofWilkinsburg, PennsylvaniaWilkinsburg,Penn Hills, PennsylvaniaPenn HillsandChurchill, PennsylvaniaChurchill. It maintains a Civic Association and a private park and swim club for residents.

Blackridge is definedcite webhttp://www.blackridge-bca.org/membership/membership.aspWelcome to the Blackridge Civic AssociationBlackridge Civic Association2011-08-262011-08-26as the territory bounded on the West by Graham Boulevard, on the South by William Penn Highway, on the East by Beulah Road and the Churchill Country Club property, from the Churchill Country Club property along Orlando Place to Atkinson Place, Atkinson Place to Pine Way, and Pine Way to Graham Boulevard, and shall include the properties fronting on both sides of said portions of Country Club Drive, Orlando Place, Atkinson Place and Pine Way.
